Posts.Content: Jul 28, 2013 09:58AM katbob wrote: Yes.  Just developing skin mets last 2 months, with lung mets surg. in 2007, and return in both lungs this year.  I will be starting Halaven this week, but have a choice of clinical trial using xeloda and avastin-like drug .  Wish I could get rid of the skin mets-not a pretty site!  I have been stage 4 for 7 years but 2013 has been a hard one.  What are your plans for treatment?  Photo therapy has been suggested for the skin mets, but hard to find anyone who does it.

Posts.Title: Ct scan results cathy50 luvtotravel

Posts.Content: Jun 24, 2008 12:02AM katbob wrote: Joan, I had back pain while on Femara, so had bone scan done.  Saw one area on rib(this had hurt some but not when the test was done).  It turned out to be a rib fx., and I was told by my oncologist that with a single area, it would be unusual for it to be mets.  The biopsy will tell you for sure, but it certainly can be something else.  Wishing you well. KE/RN

Posts.Title: How Many Are We? DivineMrsM kt1966

Posts.Content: katbob wrote: Just got back from MD appt.  I had an MRI on Monday, and it shows no change from July.  I have a hard  1 inch lump in the r underarm  that they feel is residual CA(inoperable), but it isn't growing so yahoo!!!  I have now been stage !V for 27months and feel really good.  I have avoided chemo-currently on Aromasin. I did do radiation and clinical  trial with Tykerb in '06 as reoccurence was triple neg.  With single lung met last Dec and VATS surgery to remove that, my receptors were changed back to estrogen +, thus the Aromasin-I want it to work forever, is that too much for to ask for! I feel so happy and relieved-atleast until Feb. when they will scan again.Hope we all can get good news as we head into the holiday season.  Bless all you ladies, you are so important to me. Dx 7/7/2006, IDC, 1cm, Stage IV, Grade 3, 1/13 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: good scan report katbob AusAla

Posts.Content: Nov 19, 2008 12:39PM katbob wrote: Yes!!!!  I think this is great news.  I have a 1" knot (inoperable) in my underarm, has been the same for a year now, MD thinks it is probably cancer but as long as it doesn't grow, all is well.  I have been on Aromasin only this past year, and have felt great.  I also took tykerb for 15 months a few years ago on a clinical trial-they don't usually give it to HER- people, but I see you are , too.  celebrate , it is good.
Posts.Title: Results in- can I celebrate this? SunshineSmiles pinkpig

Posts.Content: Jan 26, 2008 05:29PM katbob wrote: I had an upper right lung lobectomy Dec. 7th for a single metastatic breast nodule(I think  oligometastatic means small amt).  I t was ER+, PR+ like yours but not Her 2 +.  I am currently only on  aromasin.  If you search oligometastatic-I found several articles based on 2005/2006 studies that found people who had surgery for these lone mets had a much better prognosis.  Not to say it isn't serious, but as tripneg said earlier, give your self permission to be optimistic.  Good luck.  KE/RN
Posts.Title: Help! Looking for someone who has been through the same thing! lburchfi lburchfi

Posts.Content: Apr 3, 2008 11:43AM katbob wrote: I had the vats surgery Dec. '07, and got along fine.  It wasn't too bad, the chest tube was the most aggravating.  I had that in for 5 days as they removed the whole upper lobe and I had a small air leak that was slow to seal off.. With luck, you could be out of the hospital in 2 days.  I had very little pain-I received toradol tablets in the hospital and took nothing once I got home.  Good luck next Monday. KE/RN
Posts.Title: Good wishes please 30something katie11

Posts.Content: Feb 16, 2009 02:14PM katbob wrote: I was on Tykerb for 15 months , had no side effects, and I think it did its job.  Axilliary tumors disappeared(also was getting radiation) .  I was taken off it when tumor found in lung that when tested had reverted to estrogen +.  I believe it works even if you have no side effects!  The proof is in the scans.  Hang in there, AusAla.
Posts.Title: side effects for tykerb YHong YHong

Posts.Content: Dec 16, 2012 01:28PM katbob wrote: I was the director of a Hospice and agree with Tina's post above.  The nurses are experts on symptom management, and make up a team which includes social work, aide care,  therapy etc.  Now is the perfect time to get started.   You decide how much help you need/want. If/when things deteoriate, they know you and you will feel comfortable with them.  Waiting until there is a crisis makes Hospice much less effective.  You can go on and off of Hospice if it is not helpful.
Posts.Title: Can't sleep, exhausted and extremely dry lips julie26 bhd1

Posts.Content: Jan 23, 2012 10:22AM katbob wrote: I have been on Navelbine, 2 weeks on, 1 off, since Sept. and am having no problems.  I do take neupogen inj. 1 x a week for low WBC's.  I think the fatigue issue is very minor.  Do have to manage the constipation issue, but other than that it is a breeze.  I have had no nausea/indigestion.  I am retired, but think I could have easily worked  being on this drug.  Everyone is different, but I highly recommend it.
Posts.Title: Need Info on Navelbine LuAnnH jcb51

Posts.Content: Jan 22, 2008 04:59PM katbob wrote: This is an interesting discussion since I appear to be an exception to the rule.  I originally was ER+ in 1998, then had a chest wall recurrence in 2006 that was triple -.  Finally, had a lung resection in Dec'07 and this turned out to be a breast met but was highly ER+.  Whether the triple -was a new primary, or the latest met was a left over from original diagnosis that did nothing for 9+ years, I don't think anyone knows for sure.  I do know that all three er status were confirmed, and I am just glad that it is ER+.  I do agree with Luann though, and do not think you should feel that you hadn't done all that you should have.  I probably have two primaries, although the MD's did not think so. KE/RN
Posts.Title: Question about mets jansdaughter jansdaughter

Posts.Content: Sep 25, 2012 10:07AM katbob wrote: Since Lilly lady didn't mention it I will, think about adding another pill-concerta(long acting ritalin). Based on what I read on these boards, I forced my MD to order this for fatigue.  I am on Abraxane and wanted to maximize my energy.  It definitely has helped there but the biggest change is my ability to concentrate!  Would help you at work stay focused.  I can't believe the amt. of heavy concentration I have been able to do now-does make me feel more like my old self, and sort of has anti-depression effects as well.  Thanks Lillylady for talking about this. These boards are so helpful. Hoping that things turn around for you.
Posts.Title: Pity party - everyone's invited nancyh sueopp

Posts.Content: Jan 26, 2008 08:48PM katbob wrote: I had a bone scan in 2006 for back pain that showed abnormal uptake in a rib- I had not had any trauma that I could think of either-it turned out to be a fractured rib-the 5th, and I think I did it exercising but it caused sharp  pain only briefly  -I have since had another rib area show up on CT scan with no trauma or obvious pain and on repeat CT it was called a fx. You have to do what makes you feel comfortable, but I am thinking it is a fracture.  Wishing you a Fracture, too.  KE/RN
